p.style: float: right; width: 250px; text-align: right; font-weight: bold; line-height: 0.01;

h5.style: font-size: 20px; font-weight: bold; text-align: center; line-height: 0.01;

p.style: font-weight: bold; margin-right: 2px; margin-left: auto; line-height: 0.1;
font-weight: bold; margin-left: auto; padding-right:2px; line-height: 0.1;
font-weight: bold; margin-left: auto; padding-right:2px; line-height: 1;

div.span: NAME OF EMPLOYED PERSON OR UNPAID APPRENTICE

div.p: 1. The correct National Insurance Number for each employed person must be shown in column 1. It is an offence not to do so.
4.Record value of contribution per week in column 6.

2. Where new employees are hired in this contribution period add particulars ‑ N.I. number (if known), date of birth, and date employed. Attach completed NI 4 if National Insurance number is not known. For employees separated in this period state last date worked.
5.No contributions are due when Sickness, Maternity, Employment Injury or Invalidity Benefits are payable.
3. Salary information must be included in column 5 for each employee
6.Submit this form with your payment and completed NI 187 by the last working day of the month reported on.
WARNING! THE LAW NOW IMPOSES A PENALTY FOR THE LATE SUBMISSION OF THIS INFORMATION AND FOR INCORRECT OR INCOMPLETE INFORMATION
7. The Board will accept this information on diskette.

div.style: padding-left:50px; display: flex; justify-content: center; margin-top:-33px;

span.style: display: flex; flex-wrap: nowrap; align-items: center; padding-left:550px; padding-top:-5px;

p.style: font-weight: bold; white-space: nowrap; padding-right:10px; padding-left:25px; padding-top:-5px;
